perturbation.original_text: REVENUE SHARE/FEE: Commencing on March 1, 2020 and thereafter, the Parties shall share revenue generated from Customer's consumer offerings, including but not limited to its content, technology, traffic, data, websites, apps, videos and podcasts, without offset and regardless of which Party is responsible for securing such revenue, as per the attached Schedule 1.
perturbation.changed_text: REVENUE SHARE/FEE: Commencing on March 1, 2020 and thereafter, the Parties shall share revenue generated from Customer's consumer offerings, including but not limited to its content, technology, traffic, data, websites, apps, videos and podcasts, without offset only if Kubient is responsible for securing such revenue, as per the attached Schedule 1.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces ambiguity by contradicting the original text stating revenue sharing regardless of which party secures the revenue. The modified text now states that revenue sharing only applies if Kubient is responsible. This creates a contradiction and could lead to disputes over revenue allocation.

perturbation.original_text: *All "Revenue" calculations shall refer to gross revenue actually received by the collecting party less client credits and allowances for returns, but without any deduction or offset for costs incurred by either Party, except for "Direct Deals". For "Direct Deals", "Revenue" shall refer to Net Revenue, defined as gross revenue actually received by the collecting party less client credits and allowances for returns and less any agreed upon costs incurred by either Party in support of a "Direct Deal" for such things as production, photography, video, content creation and/or media buying (i.e. Nativo).
perturbation.changed_text: *All "Revenue" calculations shall refer to gross revenue actually received by the collecting party less client credits and allowances for returns, but without any deduction or offset for costs incurred by either Party, except for "Direct Deals". For "Direct Deals", "Revenue" shall refer to gross revenue actually received by the collecting party.
perturbation.explanation: Here, the definition of revenue for Direct Deals has been altered. Previously it was clearly defined as net revenue (gross revenue less certain costs). This change modifies the definition, causing ambiguity. If other parts of the contract refer back to the 'Revenue' definition within this section, it is now unclear whether 'Direct Deals' revenue is gross or net, leading to potential financial disputes.

perturbation.original_text: ***"Direct Deals" shall refer to any sort of sponsorship or customized off-platform opportunity (e.g., via AP's native or social media channels) introduced by Kubient. Kubient shall have no right to or interest in "Revenue" generated from Direct Deals with Regions Bank, Undertone, or Healthgrades. Kubient shall have no right to or interest in "Revenue" generated from Nativo, except for new "Direct Deals" introduced by Kubient that generate Net Revenue.
perturbation.changed_text: ***"Direct Deals" shall refer to any sort of sponsorship or customized off-platform opportunity (e.g., via AP's native or social media channels). Kubient shall have no right to or interest in "Revenue" generated from Direct Deals with Regions Bank, Undertone, or Healthgrades.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly stated that Kubient has no right to revenue from Nativo, except for new direct deals. The new definition removes this exception, causing a contradiction with the older version of the document. Whether Kubient has right to revenue from Nativo or not is unclear, opening it up to dispute.
